1901510.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901510.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901510
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 001
1901510.text: 'A’isha said: “Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): ‘What an excellent condiment vinegar is'!”

1901520.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901520.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901520
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 002
1901520.text: An-Nu'man ibn Bashir said: “Do you not have what you want in the way of food and drink? I have seen your Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace), and the poor-quality dates [daqal] that he finds are what fills his stomach."

1901530.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901530.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901530
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 003
1901530.text: Jabir ibn 'Abdi’llah said: Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): 'What an excellent condiment vinegar is!’”

1901540.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901540.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901540
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 004
1901540.text: Zahdam al-Jarmi said: "We were in the presence of Abu Musa al- Ash'ari when he was brought some chicken meat. A man among the people thereupon turned away, so he asked him: 'What is the matter?' He replied: 'I saw it eating something putrid, so I swore that I would not eat it.' He [Abu Musa] said: 'Draw near, for I have seen Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) eating the meat of chickens'!”

1901550.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901550.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901550
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 005
1901550.text: Ibrahim ibn 'Umar ibn Safina, on the authority of his father reported that his grandfather said: "I ate together with Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) the meat of a bustard.”

1901560.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901560.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901560
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 006
1901560.text: Zahdam al-Jarmi said: "We were in the presence of Abu Musa al-Ash'ari. Among the people there was a man from the Banu Taimi’llah, ruddy as if he were a freed slave, and he did not draw near, so Abu Musa said to him: 'Draw near, for I saw Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) eat some of it,' but he said: 'I saw it eat something and I found it loathsome, so I swore that I would never taste it'!”

1901570.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901570.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901570
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 007
1901570.text: Ata’ ibn Abi Asid, said: “Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): ‘Eat [olive] oil, and anoint with it, for it is from a blessed tree!’”

1901580.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901580.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901580
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 008
1901580.text: 'Umar ibn al-Khattab (may Allah the Exalted be well pleased with him) said: “Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): ‘Eat oil, and anoint with it, for it is from a blessed tree'!”

1901590.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901590.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901590
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 009
1901590.text: Another chain reports similar to the previous narration and it did not mention "related from 'Umar (RA)"

1901600.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901600.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901600
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 010
1901600.text: Anas ibn Malik said: “The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to admire the gourd, so when he was brought a meal or invited to one, I would seek it out and set it in front of him, because I knew that he liked it.”

1901610.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901610.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901610
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 011
1901610.text: Hakim ibn Jabir reported that his father said: "I entered the presence of the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace), and I saw beside him a gourd being carved into pieces, so I said: 'What is this?' He said: 'We use it to augment our meal'."

1901620.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901620.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901620
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 012
1901620.text: Anas ibn Malik said: “A tailor invited Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) to a meal he had made, so I went with Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) to that meal. He presented Allah's Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) with some barley-bread and broth containing a gourd and jerked meat. Then I saw the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) looking for chunks of gourd all around the bowl, and and I've loved gourd ever since.”

1901630.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901630.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901630
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 013
1901630.text: 'A’isha said: "The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to love sweets and honey.”

1901640.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901640.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901640
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 014
1901640.text: Umm Salama informed 'Ata ibn Yasar that she served Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) a grilled flank, so he ate from it, then embarked on the ritual prayer and did not perform the minor ritual ablution.

1901650.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901650.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901650
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 015
1901650.text: 'Abdu’llah ibn al-Harith said: "Together with Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace), we ate grilled meat in the mosque.”

1901660.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901660.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901660
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 016
1901660.text: Al-Mughira ibn Shu'ba said: “I was a guest one night together with Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace), so he was brought a grilled flank. Then he took the blade and set about carving, and he carved some for me. Bilal arrived calling him to prayer, so he threw the blade away, and he said: ‘Why have his hands been soiled?’ His mustache hung down close to his mouth, so he said to him: ‘I shall clip it for you over a tooth-stick,’ or: ‘Clip it over a tooth-stick'!”

1901670.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901670.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901670
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 017
1901670.text: Abu Huraira said: ‘The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) was brought some meat, so the foreleg was set before him, and he liked it, so he took a bite of it.”

1901680.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901680.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901680
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 018
1901680.text: Ibn Mas'ud said: "The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to like the foreleg [of the cooked sheep]." He [Ibn Mas'ud] also said: "He was poisoned with a foreleg, however, as he used to believe that the Jews had poisoned him.”

1901690.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901690.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901690
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 019
1901690.text: Abu 'Ubaid said: "I cooked a dish for the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace), and he used to take great pleasure in the foreleg [of the cooked sheep],so I passed him the foreleg. Then he said: 'Pass me the foreleg,' so I passed it to him. Then he said: 'Pass me the foreleg,' so I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, how many forelegs does a sheep have?' He said: 'By the One in whose Hand is my soul, if you kept silent, you would surely pass me the foreleg whenever I asked for it!’”

1901700.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901700.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901700
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 020
1901700.text: 'A’isha said (may Allah be well pleased with her): “The foreleg was not the meat dearest to Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace), but he only got to have meat occasionally, so he would rush to it, because it was the part that got done the most quickly.”

1901710.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901710.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901710
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 021
1901710.text: 'Abdu’llah ibn Ja'far said: “I heard Allah’s Messenger say (Allah bless him and give him peace): ‘The best of the meat is the back'.”

1901720.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901720.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901720
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 022
1901720.text: 'A’isha said (may Allah be well pleased with her): "The Prophet said (Allah bless him and give him peace): 'What an excellent condiment vinegar is'!”

1901730.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901730.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901730
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 023
1901730.text: Umm Hani said: "The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) entered my presence and said: 'Do you have anything in your possession?' I said: 'No, apart from some dry bread and vinegar', so he said: 'Give me some! A household in which there is vinegar is not devoid of seasoning'!”

1901740.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901740.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901740
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 024
1901740.text: Abu Musa al-Ash'ari said that the Prophet said (Allah bless him and give him peace): “The superiority of 'Aisha over all other women is like the superiority of tharid [a dish of sopped bread, meat and broth] over all other food.”

1901750.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901750.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901750
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 025
1901750.text: Anas ibn Malik said: “Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace):‘The superiority of 'A'isha over all other women is like the superiority of tharid [a dish of sopped bread, meat and broth] over all other food'.”

1901760.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901760.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901760
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 026
1901760.text: Abu Huraira (may Allah be well pleased with him) said that he saw Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) perform the minor ritual ablution because of eating cottage cheese. Then he saw him eat from the flank of a sheep, and then perform the ritual prayer without performing the minor ritual ablution.

1901770.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901770.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901770
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 027
1901770.text: Anas ibn Malik said: "Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) gave a wedding banquet for Safiyya consisting of dried dates and parched barley.”

1901780.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901780.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901780
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 028
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 028
1901780.text: Salma said that al-Hasan ibn 'Ali, Ibn 'Abbas and Ibn Ja'far came to her and said to her: "Make us a meal consisting of that which used to delight Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace), and which used to make his food more palatable!" She replied: ‘O my dear son, do not wish for it today!’ He said: ‘Oh yes, you must make it for us!’ She therefore got up, took some barley and ground it. Then she put it into a pot, poured some oil over it, crushed the pepper and the spices, and presented it to them. She said: "This is some of that which used to delight Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace), and which used to make his food more palatable!”

1901790.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901790.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901790
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 029
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 029
1901790.text: Jabir ibn 'Abdi’llah said: “The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) came to us in our house, so we slaughtered a sheep for him, and he said: ‘It is as if they knew that we love meat'!" (This tradition is part of a longer story).

1901800.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901800.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901800
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 030
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 030
1901800.text: Jabir said: “Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) went out and I went with him, then he went in to see a woman from among the Helpers [al-Ansar], so she slaughtered a sheep for him and he ate some of it. She also brought him a dish of ripe dates, and he ate some of them. Then he performed the minor ritual ablution for the noon prayer, and performed it. Then he departed, and she brought him a leftover from the remnant of the sheep, and he ate. Then he performed the afternoon ritual prayer but did not perform the minor ritual ablution.”

1901810.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901810.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901810
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 031
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 031
1901810.text: Umm al-Mundhir said: “Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) came to see me with 'Ali. We had some suspended clusters of grapes, so Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) started to eat, and 'Ali was eating with him. Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) therefore said to 'Ali: ‘Take it easy, O ‘Ali, for you are a convalescent!’ So 'Ali sat down while the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) ate, and I offered them some chard and barley. The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) said to 'Ali: ‘Eat some of this, for this is more appropriate for you'!”

1901820.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901820.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901820
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 032
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 032
1901820.text: 'A’isha, the Mother of the Believers (may Allah be well pleased with her), said: "The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to come to me and say: “Do you have something for lunch?” I would say: “No,” so he would say: “I am fasting.” When he came to me one day, I said: “O Messenger of Allah, we have been given a gift!” He said: “What is it?” I said: “It is a meal of dates mixed with butter and curds.” He said: “As for me, I began the day fasting.” But then he ate.”

1901830.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901830.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901830
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 033
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 033
1901830.text: Yusuf ibn 'Abdi’llah ibn Salam said: “I saw the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) take a slice of barley-bread. Then he put a dried date on it and said: ‘This is the condiment for this,’ and he ate it.”

1901840.book: What Rasoolullah Would Eat with Bread
1901840.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901840
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 034
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 034
1901840.text: Anas said about Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace): "He used to like the dregs [ath-thufl].” 'Abdullah said: “That means what is left over from the meal.”
